headline: Senior Consultant at Dynamis, Inc.
summary: Media professional with more than 10 years of experience in journalism, communications and digital media. Proven ability to successfully coordinate online content strategies, work on deadline and complete tasks with attention to detail. Successfully worked for high-profile media companies including ESPN, Scripps and Gannett. Possesses security clearance.

defaultPosition.description:
Supports the second largest investigative unit of the federal government through writing and editing both internal and external content for the Office of Public Affairs' (OPA) strategic communications unit.

Supports the Executive Associate Director's office of Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) through writing internal and external communications on behalf of HSI leadership. 

Provides technical writing and editing support for ICE's Student and Exchange Visitor Program.

Writes long form feature stories that highlight the people, work and mission of ICE. 

Creates effective social media messaging for ICE social networks. 

Creates innovative strategic communications plans for numerous OPA initiatives. 

Works directly with agency staff both domestic and international to develop story ideas for ICE platforms.

Responsible for providing quality assurance for agency reports upon request. 

Serves as primary point of contact for all HSI-related content submitted by ICE public affairs officers

Supports HSI Budget Formulation and Strategic Planning through editing various documents including, but not limited to, Congressional inquiries and other budget-related proposals.
defaultPosition.title: Senior Writer/Editor

positions.description:
Supports the second largest investigative unit of the federal government through writing and editing both internal and external content for the Office of Public Affairs' (OPA) strategic communications unit.

Supports the Executive Associate Director's office of Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) through writing internal and external communications on behalf of HSI leadership. 

Provides technical writing and editing support for ICE's Student and Exchange Visitor Program.

Writes long form feature stories that highlight the people, work and mission of ICE. 

Creates effective social media messaging for ICE social networks. 

Creates innovative strategic communications plans for numerous OPA initiatives. 

Works directly with agency staff both domestic and international to develop story ideas for ICE platforms.

Responsible for providing quality assurance for agency reports upon request. 

Serves as primary point of contact for all HSI-related content submitted by ICE public affairs officers

Supports HSI Budget Formulation and Strategic Planning through editing various documents including, but not limited to, Congressional inquiries and other budget-related proposals.
positions.title: Senior Writer/Editor

positions.description:
Serves as POS contract task lead for ICE Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP) technical writing and editing team. 

Serves as senior writer and editor in support of ICE's Homeland Security Investigations front office,  the Office of Public Affairs and Budget Formulation and Strategic Planning teams. 

Supervises team of three editors who support SEVP's strategic communications team. 

Serves as primary liaison between contractors and federal government staff on all strategic communications and editorial matters.

Makes final editorial decisions on SEVP editorial and strategic communications support issues.

Consults with Dynamis leadership on best practices for internal and external communications. 

Creates communications messages for Dynamis internal and external corporate correspondence.

Writes proposals on behalf of company in response to official Requests for Proposals (RFPs) from potential government clients. 

Drafts win themes, statements of past performance and deliverable solutions for company proposals. 

Provides effective and detailed quality assurance for corporate proposals and official requests for information (RFI).
positions.title: Senior Consultant/Task Lead

positions.description:
- Provides media coaching and consultation for professional athletes, entertainers and communications professionals. 

- Provides social and traditional media training for individuals, small businesses and corporations 

- Develops effective brand strategies for digital space. 

- Provides consulting services for short and long term content planning. 

- Offers editorial guidance for aspiring and/or established writers, producers and executives.

- Available for speaking engagements for high school and collegiate level journalism and communications students.

- Provides freelance editorials for various websites on sports and social issues. 

- Provides commentary on sports and social-related issues to select radio and podcast shows.
positions.title: Founder, CEO

positions.description:
- Managed digital communications for the largest association of trial lawyers.
 
- Led communications staff's efforts to develop effective online communications strategies.
 
- Consulted on major redesign of both justice.org and takejusticeback.com
 
- Managed websites and social networks of AAJ and Take Justice Back -- AAJ's grassroots campaign.
 
- Led efforts to communicate AAJ's message through video and social networks.
 
- Wrote blogs, scripts and talking points for accurate delivery of AAJ's message through digital channels. 

- Produced and edited video for use on all online platforms.
positions.title: Digital Communications Coordinator

positions.description:
- Managed day-to-day content for PR Newsâ website. 

- Wrote approx. 3-5 posts a week for PR News website. These posts vary in topics, depending on what's "hot" among communications professionals. 

- Involved in production and editing of weekly PR News newsletter.

- Moderated PR-related webinars. Hosted panels at PR News conferences.
positions.title: Senior Editor

positions.description:
- Managed day-to-day content for ESPN.comâs New York local site. 

-Assigned and edited content for coverage of all major NY professional and collegiate sports teams.

- Consulted on a daily basis with team of editors and writers on how to best cover each event. 

- Planned and executed comprehensive coverage plan for 2011 and 2012 NFL drafts.

- Assisted in planning and execution of coverage for New York Giants Super Bowl XLVI victory.

-Communicated daily with supervisors on long-term project ideas.
positions.title: Associate Editor, ESPNNewYork.com

positions.description:
-Managed day-to-day content for ESPN.comâs NFL section.

-Assigned and edited NFL-related copy for a team of 15 writers for ESPN.com.

-Developed and maintained relationships with other editors and writers of ESPN.com in order to share ideas, concepts and cross-platform plans.

-Assisted with the strategic planning of events such as the Super Bowl and NFL Draft.
positions.title: Associate Editor, NFL

positions.description:
-Covered local high schools and colleges and reported on deadline.

-Maintained weekly column of current and former Knoxville-area athletes

-Organized and edited copy on deadline.
positions.title: Sportswriter/Columnist
